roleset.name: light verb with 'offer' or 'bid'

role.descr: offer/bid, or shares if being tendered to an offer

example.name: expected transitive active
example.text: It shed about 7 pence, however, after dealers said the market was disappointed that [Ford]-1 didn't move *trace*-1 to tender a bid for control of the company.
example.arg: a bid for control of the company

example.name: expected passive
example.text: The offer, which was due to expire yesterday, is conditional on [50.1% of Dunkin's common shares]-1, on a fully diluted basis, being tendered *trace*-1 and on the withdrawal of the company's poison pill rights plan.

example.name: active, unexpected arg2
example.text: LIN Broadcasting surged 4 5/8 to 112 5/8; LIN and BellSouth sweetened their merger agreement in an attempt to keep [shareholders]-1 from *trace*-1 tendering their shares to McCaw Cellular Communications.

example.name: passive, unexpected arg2
example.text: At the close of business Thursday, Ciba-Geigy and Chiron said [11,580 common shares]-1 had been tendered *trace*-1 to their offer.

roleset.note: WSJ usage does not accord at all with my intuition. It could be that this will have to be revamped to bring it more in line with 'offer'. Comparison to 'offer'. No Vncls.

predicate.note: Frames file for 'tender' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.
